meanings.definition: To cut out or remove surgically.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon will exsect the tumor carefully.
meanings.sent2: The dentist needed to exsect the decayed tooth.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I could exsect the bad grade from my report card.
meanings.sent4: She exsected the negative thoughts from her mind like a skilled surgeon.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to exsect the dead branches to save the tree.

meanings.sent1: The chef will exsect the bones from the fish fillet.
meanings.sent2: It was necessary to exsect the foreign object embedded in the skin.
meanings.sent3: He tried to exsect the annoying song lyrics from his memory.
meanings.sent4: She exsected the toxic relationship from her life with determination.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist had to exsect the artifact from the ancient ruins delicately.
